translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on sitting down
The second training rule on well-covered

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyaṁ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū kāyam vivaritvā antara ghare nisīdanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were sitting down in inhabited areas with their bodies uncovered. …

analyzed: su paṭicchannaḥ antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will sit down well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should be well-covered while sitting down in an inhabited area.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca kāyaṁ vivaritvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca kāyam antaraghare nisīdati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits down in an inhabited area with his body uncovered, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: a san cit ca  assatiyā  a jānantassa
translated: There is no offense if it is unintentional,🔽if he does not know,🔽if he is not aiming at disrespect,
if he is sick,🔽if he is traveling,🔽if there are dangers,
if he is the first offender.🔽The fourth training rule is finished.
